derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin, literally something to be brought to mind', gerundive of memorare. The original use was as an adjective, placed at the head of a note of something to be remembered or of a record made for future reference

entry.def: A memorandum is a written report that is prepared for a person or committee in order to provide them with information about a particular matter.

example.ex: ...a memorandum from the Ministry of Defence on its role...
example.tran: 国防部发出的关于其职责的备忘录

example.ex: The delegation submitted a memorandum to the Commons on the blatant violations of basic human rights.
example.tran: 代表团向下院呈交了有关公然侵犯基本人权的备忘录。

entry.def: A memorandum is an informal communication between governments which often states a particular diplomatic purpose or point of view.

example.ex: ...a memorandum of understanding for co-operation between our two countries.
example.tran: 为我们两国之间的合作而达成的谅解备忘录

entry.tran: (公司或组织内部的)公务便条，备忘录
entry.def: A memorandum is a short official note that is sent by one person to another within the same company or organization.

stems_affixes.word_buile: com共同+memor记忆+able……的→大家该一起记住→值得纪念的
im不+memor记忆+ial……的→不能记得的→远古的
memor记忆+andum东西→帮助记的东西→备忘录

stems_affixes.value_cn: 记忆,记忆力;回忆;存储[器]
stems_affixes.word_buile: memor记忆+y状态,性质→n.记忆,记忆力;回忆;存储[器]
re再+membr=memor记忆+ance表名词→n.记得,记忆
com共同+memor记住+ate表动词→大家一起记住→纪念

stems_affixes.value_cn: 记住;[to]转达问候,代……致意,代……问好
stems_affixes.word_buile: re再+member=memor记忆→再记得→回忆,记忆

Sentence.sentence: Robert Summers, who has taught at Cornell Law School for about 40 years, announced this week in a detailed, footnoted memorandum - that he would ban laptop computers from his class on contract law.

sentences.cn: 备忘录上注明的日期是2008 年8 月23 日。

sentences.en: The Secretary notes down the date of the meeting in her memorandum book.
sentences.cn: 秘书把会议日期都写在记事本上。
